channel.title: Check More Types on Tori Code
channel.description: Recent content in Check More Types on Tori Code

item.title: JavaScript check if a number is a valid port using check-more-types library
item.description: In this JavaScript tutorial we learn how to check if a given number is a valid port number or not using the check-more-types library. Via different JavaScript examples we learn how to validate port, system port or user port number. (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({}); Create the sample project Firstly we create an empty project with the following command. mkdir sample-project cd sample-project npm init -y And install the check-more-types module using the following command.

item.title: JavaScript check if a number is odd or even using check-more-types library
item.description: In this JavaScript tutorial we learn how to check whether a number is even or odd using the check-more-types library. (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({}); Create the sample project Firstly we create an empty project with the following command. mkdir sample-project cd sample-project npm init -y And install the check-more-types module using the following command. npm install check-more-types --save (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).

item.title: JavaScript simple email validation using check-more-types library
